intro: Sarcotoechia villosa, commonly known as the hairy sarcotoechia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sarcotoechia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
